Bought this game a little while after it's release date so it's a game that has grown on me, makes me feel kind of nostalgic too, but well, that's not the important thing.

It is an amazing game that makes you feel all kind of feelings from fear to happiness to sadness to anger in less than 20 seconds, it is incredible addictive because there's always something new to try, each game feels completely different than the other.

If you haven't bought it yet just do it, no matter what kind of games you usually play, if you give DbD an opportunity I promise you you're not gonna regret it, there's a lot to do, a lot to learn, and overall, a lot of fun to get.

Pros - Fun, simple gameplay loop. Does the horror aspect and iconic characters chasing you justice.

Cons- Horrible load times, glitches, a mobile game esque 3 currency tier system on top of a battle pass. Awkward and at times poor leveling system. Only way to get certain content is time locked or through a paywall. 

Map voting would be a nice feature. As well as more easy to access game lore. Game has made way too much money to be optimized this poorly in my opinion, and especially to gate off content especially to a new player is straight up uninviting. I'm glad I got this at a price drop, at full price I'd feel ripped off.

Literally unplayable as a killer. Tried to play a few games and all the survivors have to do is blind you with a flashlight. I am not exaggerating when I say the blinding, or crowd-control effect, lasts upwards of 30 seconds. You literally cannot play the game for up to 30 seconds. Who in the world thought this was a good idea?

Used to feel balanced well enough; however, it's way too easy to exploit mechanics. May be worth it if you're only playing survivor. That's only half the game though. Before you could typically kill two survivors with enough effort and have it be a close game. Now, you're lucky enough to hook a single survivor once or twice. 

I was excited to see all the new gimmicks--may have even bought a couple--but buying a new killer is pointless when it's so easy to counter them now. Like most games that add more and more characters/mechanics/perks, it leads to a horribly un-enjoyable, imbalanced mess.

Alles in allem eine nette Spielidee mit vielen unterschiedlichen Killern.
Es empfiehlt sich aber mit Ruhe und Gelassenheit an das Spiel heran zu gehen, da es doch immer wieder frustrierende Runden auf Grund von toxischen Überlebenden oder campenden/ tunnelnden Killern gibt, die einem den Spielspaß nehmen können. Auch empfiehlt es sich gelegentlich den Endgamechat zu ignorieren.
Wer das schafft hat hier ein Spiel, das auch längerfristig Spaß macht und durch regelmäßige DLCs (auch wenn man sie sich nicht selbst kauft) immer wieder neue Spannung in das Spiel bringt.

The balance of humans and butchers raises blood pressure, nothing to say. When I meet a cheater, I click to quit the game, and I fxxx ban me from the game, but there is no punishment for the cheater. This smart game company never cares about cheating. They only ban people who modify game data. Modifying game data affects the game company's earnings, while cheating does not affect earnings.
Hidden scores are disgusting, don't you know, your company? There are many people who use this mechanism to deliberately lower the hidden score and bully new players and low-level players. 
Do you like forcing lower level players to leave???
I don't understand what your company thinks, as an online game, fairness is very important, but you don't. Please strengthen the supervision of cheating, and optimize hidden score. In the same game, ensure that players are close to each other, rather than being exploited by some players to bully newbies and low-level players.
